Job description

About The Company

Our client is a proudly Australian owned food manufacturing organisation. They are now seeking an experienced purchasing professional to join their site in the North of Melbourne.

About The Role

The core focus of the role is to ensure the availability of raw materials and services for the site, that will lead to the efficient manufacture of product to meet customer demand. Key resonsibilities will include:
  • Manage supply and availability of raw materials
  • Review, raise, and approve purchases for all materials
  • Maintain inventory within budget and forecast
  • Identify opportunities to improve supply performance or cost
  • Manage data within Pronto ERP system and participate in NPD process

Skills & Experience

Applicants should have demonstrated experience as a Buyer or Purchaser, ideally gained in an FMCG manufacturing environment. You will be commercially savvy, posses a strong analytical skill set, and have a well developed communication skillset.

Coordinator Civil Design (100202)

Company Name Hume City Council Company Location Broadmeadows, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 35 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

$109,364pa (Band 8) Plus Vehicle Allowance and super *Full Time


Hume City Council has an exciting opportunity in a leadership role for an enthusiastic and motivated engineer to join the Assets department as Coordinator Civil Design.

The Coordinator Civil Design will lead a dedicated team that is focused on delivering the design of civil infrastructure, undertaking and analysing matters relating to storm water drainage and providing a high level of customer service.

The successful applicant is to have tertiary qualifications in Civil Engineering with demonstrate experience and expertise in civil design and managing staff. Highly developed interpersonal and customer service skills are essential.


Key Skills


  • Demonstrated ability to lead, empower, supervise, delegate, train and develop tertiary qualified and experienced staff and ensure adherence to standards, guidelines, Council policies and procedures.
  • Demonstrated ability to undertake and oversee the design, preparation of plans, specifications, estimates, tender and contract documents for various civil infrastructure projects.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to prepare reports, briefings, submissions and relevant correspondence and ability to communicate clearly using approaches suitable to the audience and to achieve maximum impact.


Company Profile


Hume City Council is a leader in local government and is recognised for its innovation, initiative, leadership, service, quality and support for its people.


Hume City is one of Australia's fastest-growing communities and with more people choosing to call Hume home, we're expected to welcome more than 57,000 new residents to our City over the next decade.


What We Offer


With our high level of employee engagement, Hume City Council offers a great working environment where you can develop your career. We offer flexible work arrangements and other benefits, such as study assistance and interest free loans for public transport. Our strong commitment to social justice and the environment provides opportunities for employees to participate in various programs.


For further information, view the attached position description or contact Nick Varvaris on 9205 2419.


To apply for this job go to: www.hume.vic.gov.au/careers/Jobs_And_Opportunities.

Applications close 18 September 2018(Job ID:4331105)

Senior Test Analyst

Company Name Intelematics Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 245 views

Job description

The Senior Test Analyst is responsible for designing, developing, executing and leading quality assurance and control processes, test strategies, test plans and test cases.


The Senior Test Analyst will also provide technical guidance and contribute to uplifting the quality capability of the team.


The successful candidate will be involved in...


  • Pro-actively leading and helping to shape our quality assurance practices
  • Providing technical solution input to unit test code and functional automation tests for the development of robust, stable and scalable apps
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to test and deploy products and features
  • Owning test case documentation and management
  • Owning defect management and test reporting
  • Prioritising testing efforts according to project/product risk
  • Estimating time and effort according to iteration plans
  • Assisting in the development of automated tools and processes to provide continuous delivery
  • Support bug fixing and the pursuit of continuous improvement
  • Continuously discovering, evaluating, and implementing new technologies and processes


Benefits and perks


  • Work with passionate, collaborative and diverse teams
  • Work in an autonomous and growth focused Agile environment
  • Take advantage of our commitment to your ongoing learning and development
  • Flexible ways of working available
  • Professional Educational Assistance available
  • Paid Parental Leave available
  • Receive generous discounts on RACV products and services (Insurance products, Roadside Assist, Club Membership, Accommodation, Movie Tickets, Airport Parking and Car Hire)
  • Receive new vehicle discounts via our client partners


Skills and experience


We are looking for someone who...


  • Is tertiary qualified in Computer Science or Information Technology
  • Has ISTQB or Agile test certifications
  • Has a minimum of 6 years experience in the delivery of software testing
  • Is familiar with Agile methodologies such as Scrum, Lean and Kanban
  • Has a strong understanding of end to end testing activities, including test traceability, test case writing, bug reporting etc
  • Is familiar with developing in continuous integrated environments, and has a strong understanding of CI and source control management tools
  • Can demonstrate experience in responsive design utilising HTML 5 / CSS 3, JavaScript and integrating automated and manual testing
  • Can demonstrate experience with the following technologies and tools:
    • Issue tracking tools such as JIRA
    • Complex SQL queries
    • Test automation frameworks such as Selenium
    • Web Services such as SOAP, RESTful
    • Automated scripting languages such as Groovy, Ruby
    • Testing frameworks such as Cucumber, xUnit

Salesforce Developer

Company Name Open Universities Australia Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 116 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We’re in an exciting growth phase transforming online education!

As a result, we have a newly created opportunity for a skilled Salesforce Developer to join the Software Engineering team to design and drive continuous improvement solutions to OUA’s Salesforce platform to deliver value.\xa0


We function in a Agile squad model with\xa0 small self sufficient teams with a high degree of autonomy, collaboration and fun ! If this interests you, read on.


Using your expertise, you will:


  • Participate in technical design and development discussions to gather insight and contribute to solutions to address user and business requirements;
  • Configure, build (customize), conduct test solutions and integrate or technical architecture components across Salesforce
  • Conduct code reviews and analysis
  • Conduct quality assurance and resolve defects and bugs to satisfaction
  • Engage in regular knowledge sharing and drive continuous improvement
  • Advise and facilitate application development activities in line with established OUA guidelines and industry best practice.

About You :\xa0

With a minimum of 4-6 years of Salesforce platform experience, you will demonstrate:


  • Strong hands on experience with front and back end Salesforce development (Apex, Visualforce, Lightning and other declarative aspects of the Salesforce platform).
  • In-depth knowledge of integration architecture and principles
  • Experience with software development practices in TDD, code refactoring, version control and CI/CD
  • Demonstrated experience implementing Salesforce to integrate with external and internal systems
  • Experience implementing Salesforce DX will be beneficial
  • Strong development background with good experience in at least one programming language is essential. A Java background will be advantageous (but any polygot experience is welcome).
  • Strong grasp of JS Framework eg. React will be valuable
  • Salesforce Certifications (particularly Platform Developer 2 and Architecture Designer) will be viewed favourably.

To fit in with our team, you enjoy working collaboratively, are highly motivated to achieve, exhibit high levels of communication and interpersonal skills, excellent problem solving and analytical capabilities.


What is in it for you?

  • Opportunity to join a growth organisation with a social purpose - where online education is truly transforming student’s lives.
  • Agile working culture being a part of the squad model driven around an aligned mission and\xa0 self sufficient teams\xa0
  • Fantastic and supportive culture
  • Great Location - Melbourne CBD based (Right next to Southern Cross station).
  • Generous Study Assistance policy.
  • Salary packaging benefits


\xa0

To find out more about Open Universities Australia (OUA), please visit our website https://www.open.edu.au.

\xa0

If this piques your interest, please click Apply now\xa0to submit your application or send in an enquiry about the role.

\xa0

Candidates need to hold working rights in order to apply.

\xa0

Please note that we are not accepting third party applications currently.

\xa0

852554167:
[

Cloud Consultant, Infrastructure, Cloud Professional Services

Company Name Google Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 156 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sydney NSW 2000, Australia; Melbourne VIC 3004, Australia

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Google Cloud Consultant, you will work directly with Google’s most strategic customers on critical projects to help them transform their businesses. Through your consulting and technical capability, you will be providing technical guidance and best practice expertise while working with client executives and technical leaders to deploy solutions via Google’s Cloud Platform.

You possess a diverse background with cloud solutions in areas such as IaaS, Developer Operations, Microservices, Containerisation, Storage, Networking, Security and OSS technology.

As a Cloud Consultant you will architect and design systems, build out proof of concepts, and compare and contrast technology alternatives to deliver technical solutions and lead flawless implementations. Often you will need to stretch products to their limit to find their breaking points.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.

Responsibilities
  • Interact with sales/partner leads and technical stakeholders to translate complex customer requirements into recommendations for appropriate solution architectures.
  • Be a trusted strategic technical advisor to Google most strategic customers working with customer technical leads, client executives, and partners to manage and deliver successful migrations to cloud solutions.
  • Identify new product features and feature gaps, provide guidance on existing product issues, and collaborate with Product Managers and engineers to influence the roadmap of Google Cloud Platform.
  • Deliver best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles and technical presentations adapting to different levels of key business and technical stakeholders.
  • Package best practices and lessons learned into thought leadership, methodologies and published assets.


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:
  • BS degree in a technical or engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of relevant work experience and 3 years of experience building cloud solutions in designing or developing with cloud solutions across data and infrastructure services.
  • Relevant experience in professional services or technical consulting. Experience in architecting and rolling out new technology and solution initiatives.
  • Ability to travel (domestic and international) 25% of the time as required.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with deployment and orchestration technologies (such as Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, OpenStack, Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible, Jenkins) along with system administration tasks in Linux, Unix, and Windows.
  • Hands on experience supporting transactional database systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra.
  • Experience in writing scripts in one or more languages such as Python, Go, or similar.
  • Working knowledge of cloud computing including virtualization, hosted services, multi-tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems and content delivery networks.
  • Understanding of open source server software (such as NGINX, RabbitMQ, Redis, Elasticsearch).
  • Strong customer-facing communication and careful listening skills. Proven success in and genuine enthusiasm for working directly with customer technical teams.


At Google, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

To all recruitment agencies Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other company location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Industry

  • Internet

Employment Type

Full-time

  • Project Management
  • Information Technology
  • Engineering

Manager - Procurement Consulting

Company Name Infosys Portland Company Location Suite 602 10 Yarra Street, Melbourne, VIC 3141, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 329 views

Job description

  • Permanent Opportunity
  • Great team culture, friendly and supportive environment
  • Career development opportunities


    • About Infosys Portland

    Infosys Portland partners with our clients to solve their most complex and challenging procurement and supply chain problems. We combine our specialist expertise with consulting rigour, leading technologies and proven services to get things done, deliver sustainable value and guide our clients into the future.

    Due to upcoming demand in our business and career progression, we are looking for individuals to join our team and make a difference for our clients.

    Headquartered in Sydney, Australia, we also have established offices in Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, Singapore, Chicago and Pune. We work with leading national and global organisations across the full spectrum of industries, in both the public and private sectors. Infosys Portland is the dedicated procurement and supply chain consulting practice within Infosys, a global provider of technology, services and consulting, with US$11 billion in annual revenue and 200,000 employees spread across the world.


    The Role

    As a Manager you will regularly be the prime point of contact for our clients, applying your problem solving skills, stakeholder management skills, analytical skills as well as experience to maximise the competitive advantage our clients derive from their supply base. The role will involve planning and leading client projects and works-streams as well as manage your team, while leveraging the experience of Infosys Portland’s subject matter experts and senior leadership.

    You will be responsible for developing and implementing procurement and supply chain organisational and value delivery strategies to solve a variety of business problems. \xa0You will work across a range of clients, projects, and industries utilising your procurement or supply chain knowledge as well as your stakeholder management and problem solving skills to meet our client’s needs.

    \xa0

    Education

    • Degree Qualifications in Engineering, Business, Economics, Commerce, Law or Science
    • MBA from a leading business school would be advantageous

    \xa0

    Experience & Competence necessary

    • At least 4-5 years’ consulting experience with solid experience in procurement, supply chain, cost out or transformation projects
    • Significant experience within or assisting blue-chip organisations
    • Proven experience managing own projects and small project teams
    • Strong analytical skills and experience of data visualisation
    • Solid functional knowledge in the areas of strategic sourcing, category management procurement transformation, SRM and supply chain
    • Exposure to best practice procurement technology and digital procurement capabilities
    • Excellent team skills with the ability to lead and/or take direction
    • Demonstrated people management skills, including coaching of both junior employees and client staff
    • Good facilitator and ability to develop a storyline for clients

    \xa0

    Behaviours & Attributes

    • Entrepreneurial spirit
    • Results & outcome oriented
    • Enthusiastic and able to drive own activities
    • Excellent verbal & communication skills
    • Time management skills

    \xa0

    Remuneration

    Attractive remuneration package including base salary, superannuation and performance bonus

    \xa0

    Join us and be part of the Infosys Portland team culture that is entrepreneurial and outcomes-focused, and take advantage of the opportunities that come with being part of a leading global organization.


    Only successful applicants will be contacted.
